<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 368, 317]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 729, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the roots of the equation \(z^{3} = 27 - 27\mathrm{i}\), giving your answers in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi \leqslant \theta < \pi\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 67, 609, 100]]<|/det|>
Let \(I_{n} = \int_{0}^{1}(1 - x)^{n}\sinh x \mathrm{d}x\), where \(n\) is a non-negative integer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 106, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 519, 127]]<|/det|>
Show that, for \(n \geqslant 2\), \(I_n = -1 + n(n-1)I_{n-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 918, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 600, 166, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 600, 364, 621]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(I_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 600, 918, 619]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z - \frac{1}{z}\right)^5\), where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 139, 643, 170]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{cosec}^{5}\theta = \frac{a}{\sin 5\theta + b\sin 3\theta + c\sin\theta},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 190, 485, 210]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 191, 920, 210]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 87, 876, 505]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 517, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{x}}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n - 1\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 567, 146, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 672, 586]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 603, 625, 644]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\frac{1}{\sqrt{r}}\mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}< \left(2 + \frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}\right)\mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{n}} - 2\mathrm{e}. \quad (5)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 255, 144, 273]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 250, 730, 280]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} e^{\sqrt{r}}\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 256, 918, 275]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 280, 915, 300]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 109, 594, 144]]<|/det|>
\[6\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +3\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +6x = \mathrm{e}^{-t},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 160, 401, 188]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\), \(x = \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 143, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 792, 89]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of \(\tanh\) and \(\operatorname {sech}\) in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 100, 583, 120]]<|/det|>
\[1 - \tanh^{2}u = \operatorname {sech}^{2}u. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 100, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 186, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 520, 442, 545]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}(\mathrm{sech}^{-1}t) = -\frac{1}{t\sqrt{1 - t^2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 520, 920, 539]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 235, 88]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 101, 715, 121]]<|/det|>
\[x = \tanh^{-1}t\qquad \mathrm{and}\qquad y = t\sech^{-1}t,\qquad \mathrm{for} 0< t< 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 144, 495, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = -\sqrt{1 - t^2} + \left(1 - t^2\right)\mathrm{sech}^{-1}t.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 336, 490]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 478]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 109, 601, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} -\frac{x + 5}{x^2 + 10x + 61} y = 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 631, 182]]<|/det|>
given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 3\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\lambda\) is an eigenvalue of the non-singular square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvector \(\mathbf{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 715, 138]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^3\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 400, 316, 419]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 425, 576, 482]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc} - 1 & 3 & 4 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -2 & 5 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 505, 144, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 505, 532, 524]]<|/det|>
Show that the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\) are \(-1, 1\) and \(5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 505, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 74, 688, 94]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A} - 2\mathbf{I} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 185, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 567, 917, 603]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \((\mathbf{A} - 2\mathbf{I})^{3} = a\mathbf{A}^{2} + b\mathbf{A} + c\mathbf{I}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 586, 920, 604]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 72, 567, 88]]<|/det|>
